content.label: I can't get past the terrible "acting".  Even the reviewers are giving an unconvincing performance. Play this game only after playing all the other games in the App Store.

Terrible graphics, ugly interface, lot's of bugs.  Go through the entire scenario for getting the gun and nothing - no gun drops down as the walk through say it will - ugh.  Did it exactly, went back to previous saved game and it still won't give up the gun.  Maybe because it knows I would shoot this game virtually if I could.  SAVE YOUR MONEY - I AM ASKING APPLE BACK FOR MINE.  One thing you won't get back is your time.  If your time is more valuable than money then save yourself the agony.  You can get your money back but are out of luck with time.  I don't get these reviews ... Here.  If the game worked I would put up with the lousy retro graphics and clunky interface.  I can't believe that Apple even let this game into the App Store!! Buyer Beware!!

Gemini Rue plays like many older style point'n'click games but keeps it relatively fresh and familiar for a touch interface. The gameplay is nothing compared to the story, which I found entertaining and satisfying (this is a singular game, no dangling threads or cliff hangers). All in all, I'd recommend it to anyone who doesn't mind a slow-paced game, and to those nostalgic for the point'n'click days of yore.

Really nice adventure game, good thematic cohesion. 
Minor problems with the interface. There's no way to examine things in your inventory and the hit targets for the buttons in the shooting game are really small and easy to miss. None of these problems greatly detract from an excellent game, nothing got me good and truly stuck either.

I really enjoyed playing Gemini Rue. If you like the old point-and-click style games, you'll have fun with this one. And if you're the kind of person who likes to mix his genres--hard-boiled detective meets sci-fi dystopia here--you'll really have a good time. Highly recommended. I wish I could find more games like this in the App Store.
Simply one of the best mobile games I've played if not thee best.
Reminded me of Gabriel knight and other simulation mystery games. Liked it quite a bit.
This game is very challenging and fun. It has voice acting too which is rare to find on ios

This is by far my favorite game on IOS and even better then games I've purchased for console or PC I absolutely love this game but my only "slight" problem with this that it isn't very long but that doesn't take away from the experience at all, I'll recommend this to anybody who like point and click games
Great game, worth the money. The storyline is good, the tutorials for using the weapon are good, all in all it's worth a buy.
This Games is Awesome
Yuk is all I can say. Couldn't do it for more than 5 minutes. Ugly pixilated graphics. Couldn't stand it.

Wadjet Eye Games always seem to create great stories in their click-and-point games since I finished all 3 Blackwell series. This story was clever and I was surprised in some of the revelation of between these two characters. You have to find out by playing this game. I really enjoyed the game and the shooting was a fun addition to this type of game. That shooting style reminds me of other old games I played like Blackthrone. Only this shooting is more challenging than Blackthrone. I also love how this game has some inspiration from Bladerunner. If you've seen the movie, you'll know what I am talking about. I finished the game in 2 days along with some assistance from walkthrough. Great ending!

This was a pretty lengthy game (maybe around 10 or 12 hours for me) but I finished it like a novel I couldn’t put down. If you like games with strong stories, this would be a great choice. You spend most of your time exploring a few areas and piecing together clues to see what to do next. Clues usually come in the form of dialogue with other characters. I got stuck a few times and had to consult walkthroughs, but for the most part it’s intuitive and rewarding. My only complaint is that you must revisit some areas too many times and do too much backtracking.  But that’s a minor thing. Overall this is a brilliant game.
I can't throw money fast enough at these guys. Full of witty humor, a noir sci-fi adventure right to my taste. I legit love you, guys.
I love the storyline, graphics, and dialogue. I am very pleased I found this game. If you're into point and click mysteries and puzzles this is the game for you.
Great port

title.label: A great game must have a Great story and this one has it

content.label: The story of the game was great and I loved the retro style graphics. There are many games with high graphics lacking a logical story and therefore they have no or minimum impact .Well worth the price.
Hope they keep up the great work as we need more of these games!!

Never mind the cretins who believe this to be an amazing game. It's obvious their notions of what constitutes "amazing" are seriously hindered by their limited imaginations. Unless you are into hideous retro graphics I suggest you close this app as quickly as possible.  Lost interest 5 minutes into the game. Not a good choice for the neocortex. If your brain is more reptilian, go for it.
Picture of game on App Store not representative of actual graphics of the game. If I had known, I wouldn't have wasted $5.

Interesting plot and characters.
Deserves continuation.
Great job.

Worst game I've ever bought. I couldn't bring myself to tolerate it for more than 30 seconds. Any review more than 1 star must have been generates by the developer. It should get 0 stars and be banned from App Store.

Excelent storyline!
The graphics are terrible. I know it is suposed to be this way. But the impression I got is that the iphone conversion was not done right, because the graphics were not only pixelated, but blured too. The mac/pc version looks much, much better.

Anyway, you can get used to it. It is worth it playing it!

This game was great- totally worth the money. The story, graphics, and delivery were excellent. Some people have complained about the combat, but I thought it was alright. If you like good RPGs with a gritty feel, get this game.
Drew me in and I couldn't put it down!
Had a great story line and was enjoyable. Like all games you get stuck on what to do next and in what sequence, (that is what walkthroughs are for). Really had a good time with it.

This is a wonderful modern point-and-click adventure. I never had to consult a guide to figure out what to do and only got stuck a few times. It feels very much like a visual novel with some puzzle elements. The "action" aspect of it is easy but changes up the gameplay a little. The real meat of this game is in the writing--it's fantastic. A really great story. The voice-acting is a little weak but that's kind of the norm for indie games. If you want a great story, you probably can't find a better game than this.
This game is awesome!! I wish there were more games like this on the App Store!!

Forget the retro theme, here is a game were you can immerse yourself into. What lacks  in graphics it makes up in the environment. It makes you feel like you are inside the story and that you have control,  Most of the games are setup for you to follow a script, this games feels like you write your own.

This is a fantastic reboot of the old '90s adventure games, but it stays away from both the frustrating pixel hunting and ridiculous game logic that caused the decline of the genre and the stale humor and gratuitous references that have plagued newer attempts at point and click adventures (I counted only one Monkey Island reference, far down from the 15 or so that seem to be standard among games like this). 

My only complaint is that the interface of the iOS port leaves something to be desired. It functions well enough and might be fine on an iPad, but on my iPod Touch 4g, the hotspots were so small that even with the ability to label all clickable items onscreen, it sometimes took up to 10 or more attempts to perform the action I wanted when interacting with items that were small or close together. (The Broken Sword iOS ports are, in my opinion, the gold standard for how to update the interface of a PC point and click game to avoid fiddly frustrations on a small touchscreen while keeping true to the spirit of the game.) 

Overall, though, this game is good and the developer should feel good. And you should buy it.
Totally worth the money. Great game. Make more!!!!
Great game. A little tough at times to figure out what exactly to do but that's why strategy guides are on the internet. Looking forward to anything else like it.
The best game I've ever played. Compares to the ROOM and the ROOM 2!! Story is compelling and the retro graphics style is captivating. Please please clever developer, another one!
Truly an excellent adventure game like those from the early 90s, with a hint of Blade Runner and William Gibson's writing.

I've played almost all of WE's games and all of them are uniquely different, but still have the same "point-and-click" fun of the games of the 90's (Space Quest, Police Quest, to name my two favorites). WE's developers have really captured the fun and mystery of P&C's in Gemini Rue - the first of theirs to be on iOS. Well done! Keep em coming!
I love the story and the voice acting is better then most. Reminds me of my Kings Quest days...waiting for more from this dev
Honestly was a bit too depressing and dark for my taste. Had a very gripping story that kept me to the bitter end, even when at times I wanted to stop playing it. Very engrossing game.

I really enjoyed this old styled game!  It reminded me of attempting to play games on the Nintendo as a kid.

If you analyze the game it has a great plot, chock full of surprises, and it has great well-developed characters.

As for the gameplay: what can you expect from an iOS game?  Honestly, I didn't mind the gameplay.  In fact I rather enjoyed the interaction portion of the game— hunting for clues and the like.  

I would like to say, however, that it would be oh so much better if it had some sort of game log that reminded you where you left off after you returned to the game from a hiatus.

I rarely give a five star review. This game has all the great memories games like Full Throttle brought us 20 years ago, and doesn't lack in story or fun. Get ready for a great marathon of 20-25 hours of excellent story telling and puzzling yet simple adventure.

Easily the funnest game I've ever played on my iPhone. Period. Awesome storyline, great character development, and the game just keeps going and going. I'm usually disappointed with adventure games from the AppStore but this one takes the cake, hands down.

Reminds me of old pixel games except that this one was really good, caught me off guard with the past and present of Charlie and Azriel as well as the connection of the two. 
Very well made.

the retro graphics and controls take me back to Kings Quest and Space Quest!
has it really been so long since I put my 6 year old in front of a Tandy and introduced him to gaming?
This game not only has bad graphics it has awful controls.  I bought it thinking it would be a good play but I just could not get into it with all of its faults.  Same your money.
I am very happy that Wadjet Eye is finally on IOS. I can't wait for the other games and new ones.
Great point and click story/adventure game. Reminds me of the Sierra games I played as a kid. Loved it!!
This is the most awesome game I've ever played!!! If you like adventure mystery game, this is the one)!!!
I enjoyed playing this game. Good story, you can see what the graphics are like before you purchase it so ...why are people complaining about that?!

title.label: Horrible graphics, terrible game play, way overpriced.

content.label: Retro is right. One step above Atari 2600.  False advertising. Really stupid puzzles.  The game action is so clunky I had flashbacks to the Commodore 64!    Avoid!
